alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Luzerne; Pike; Southern Wayne; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 22 at 3:24PM EST until January 23 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Wyoming, Lackawanna, Luzerne, Pike and Southern Wayne counties. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow moves in this evening, before changing over to a wintry mix of sleet, freezing rain and rain by late evening and the first part of the overnight. The wintry mix will change back to snow from northwest to southeast during the predawn hours Monday, with a period of moderate to locally heavy snow expected Monday morning. Snowfall rates near 1 inch per hour our possible at times, especially over the higher terrain Monday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorist to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.

area.areaDesc: Lackawanna; Luzerne; Pike; Southern Wayne; Wyoming
